dt-example.title: Focus cell custom styling
dt-example.info:
When KeyTable adds focus to a table's cell it adds a class (defined by `kt-init keys.className` - default `-string focus`). This class can be used to provide styling information to highlight the focused cell to the end user. The provided stylesheets use [CSS `outline`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline) to show focus, but any CSS property can be used.
This example uses a thin outline with a red colour and a light red background to highlight the focused cell. Click the _CSS_ tab below the table to see the CSS used.
